title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: outlines propose change MyBioconductorPackage. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("kevinrue/MyBioconductorPackage", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: Please note MyBioconductorPackage project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with MyBioconductorPackage
text: Thanks using MyBioconductorPackage! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with MyBioconductorPackage
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Getting help with MyBioconductorPackage
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. See also Bioconductor help website. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. Bioconductor-related question, please ask Bioconductor Support Website using appropriate package tag (website send automatic email package authors). people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with MyBioconductorPackage
text: efficient possible, development tidyverse packages tends bursty, shouldn’t worry don’t get immediate response. Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

title: Introduction to MyBioconductorPackage
text: R open-source statistical environment can easily modified enhance functionality via packages. MyBioconductorPackage R package available via Bioconductor repository packages. R can installed operating system CRAN can install MyBioconductorPackage using following commands R session:
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {       install.packages("BiocManager")   }  BiocManager::install("MyBioconductorPackage")  ## Check that you have a valid Bioconductor installation BiocManager::valid()

title: Introduction to MyBioconductorPackage
text: MyBioconductorPackage based many packages particular implemented infrastructure needed dealing RNA-seq data (EDIT!). , packages like SummarizedExperiment (EDIT!). asking question “start using Bioconductor?” might interested blog post.

title: Introduction to MyBioconductorPackage
text: package developers, try explain clearly use packages order use functions. R Bioconductor steep learning curve critical learn ask help. blog post quoted mentions like highlight Bioconductor support site main resource getting help: remember use MyBioconductorPackage tag check older posts. alternatives available creating GitHub issues tweeting. However, please note want receive help adhere posting guidelines. particularly critical provide small reproducible example session information package developers can track source error.

title: Introduction to MyBioconductorPackage
text: hope MyBioconductorPackage useful research. Please use following information cite package overall approach. Thank !
code: ## Citation info citation("MyBioconductorPackage") #> To cite package 'MyBioconductorPackage' in publications use: #>  #>   kevinrue (2025). _Demonstration of a Bioconductor Package_. #>   doi:10.18129/B9.bioc.MyBioconductorPackage #>   <https://doi.org/10.18129/B9.bioc.MyBioconductorPackage>, #>   https://github.com/kevinrue/MyBioconductorPackage/MyBioconductorPackage #>   - R package version 0.99.0, #>   <http://www.bioconductor.org/packages/MyBioconductorPackage>. #>  #>   kevinrue (2025). "Demonstration of a Bioconductor Package." #>   _bioRxiv_. doi:10.1101/TODO <https://doi.org/10.1101/TODO>, #>   <https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/TODO>. #>  #> To see these entries in BibTeX format, use 'print(<citation>, #> bibtex=TRUE)', 'toBibtex(.)', or set #> 'options(citation.bibtex.max=999)'.

title: Optimisations
text: Attach packages used vignettes.
code: library("BiocPkgTools") #> Loading required package: htmlwidgets library("MyBioconductorPackage") #> Loading required package: biocViews

title: Optimisations
text: save typing, get_packages_by_view() calls biocPkgList() internally pkg_list NULL (default). convenient one-calls, slow verbose multiple calls. calling get_packages_by_view() multiple times, efficient call biocPkgList() pass result get_packages_by_view().
code: pkg_list <- biocPkgList() #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest out1 <- get_packages_by_view("Spatial", pkg_list = pkg_list) out2 <- get_packages_by_view("SingleCell", pkg_list = pkg_list)

code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("MyBioconductorPackage") BiocManager::install("kevinrue/MyBioconductorPackage")

title: Demonstration of a Bioconductor Package
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub!
code: library("MyBioconductorPackage") ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: Get Packages by biocViews — get_packages_by_view
text: get_packages_by_view() returns package names associated single biocViews term. get_packages_by_views() returns packages names intersection multiple biocViews terms.

title: Get Packages by biocViews — get_packages_by_view
code: get_packages_by_view(view, pkg_list = NULL)  get_packages_by_views(views, pkg_list = NULL)

title: Get Packages by biocViews — get_packages_by_view
text: view single biocView term. pkg_list Value call biocPkgList(). NULL (default), call biocPkgList() internally. See Details. views character vector biocView term.

title: Get Packages by biocViews — get_packages_by_view
text: Character vector package names.

title: Get Packages by biocViews — get_packages_by_view
text: Calling BiocPkgTools::biocPkgList() passing result get_packages_by_view() get_packages_by_views() efficient making multiple calls. See vignette 'Optimisations' comprehensive discussion demonstration.

title: MyBioconductorPackage 0.99.0
text: NEW FEATURES Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
